{leaf.magick} - Use Modern Icon Libraries in Leaflet Markers

The goal of leaf.magick is to overcome the somewhat outdated â€œFont Awesomeâ€ implementation in vanilla R leaflet by constructing markers on the fly using fontawesome and magick. There are three issues leaf.magick sets out to overcome:

  • leaflet::awesomeIcons() is limited to Font Awesome 4 ğŸ‘

  • leaflet::awesomeIcons() is limited to a handful of discrete colours ğŸ‘

  • leaflet::awesomeIcons() is limited to a single marker size ğŸ‘

  • Vanilla leaflet doesnâ€™t provide any additional features to construct legends, icon palettes, or such like ğŸ‘

leaf.magick attempts to solve all of this:

  • magicIcons() uses up-to-date versions of Font Awesome and Boostrap Icons, powered by fontawesome and bsicons âœ…

  • magicIcons() uses fontawesome to grab a marker shape, and can therefore colour and resize it however the user desires âœ…

  • leaf.magick exports functions like addIconLegend() to help developers communicate the meanings of icons to users âœ…

Installation

You can install the development version of leaf.magick like so:

# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("jack-davison/leaf.magick")
